intro: Tragacantha brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a sticky, resinous substance known as tragacanth, which has been historically used in medicine and industry. Tragacantha brachypus thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
